The rooms in the picture looked great and when we got there you could tell there has been NO improvments in the last 10years at least, the bathroom was Discusting, looked like it had been tidyed but was discusting! Never again will i stay there it was a rip of at $70/night

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds, clean, quiet, and close to all the action”
Reviews.Author: jillallington
Reviews.Content: The reception desk staff offered great tips on nearby restaurants and were very courteous. The lobby was clean and comfortable as was our room. The bed was very comfortable and I appreciated the fan and the ability to control the room temperature easily. The breakfast at the restaurant adjacent to the lobby was healthy and delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Riflerangeblues
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights. The accommodation is fine - clean and rooms are large and have good facilities. If I was to be picky, I'd say they are getting a little dated, but it didn't affect our stay at all. Reception was efficient and pleasant, but I wouldn't say it was warm or informative, but we weren't really that bothered. Overall, a good hotel for a city break and only 10 mins walk from the sea wall and ferries to Granville Island.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tuck96
Reviews.Content: we stayed 4 nights prior to a alaska cruise - the hotel kindly upgraded us free to a suite which was great - very comfortable bed and despite being right next to the lifts no noise at all. Very clean room and good decor. Great location for walking either to Granville Island or Robson st for the shops - great restaurants within walking distance and taxi rank opposite for any other places. Internet access in the foyer was very helpful and the bar was very welcoming. The only problme came when hordes of people came in on a bus and the staff could not cope too well but then did feel bad that some of my fellow brits were quite rude to them. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel in downtown location”
Reviews.Author: Markus N
Reviews.Content: We have chosen this hotel mainly for its price and the central location. It is one of those typical locations where people check-in for the night arriving in Vancouver or before their departure. We noticed a fair number of tourists in the lobby, which, by the way, looks quite nice and is occupied with professional and very friendly staff. It is a bit tricky to get to the hotel. I definitely recommend reading the "how to get to/ map" page of the hotel's website. If you like to use the underground parking they charge an additional nightly fee. The room itself has a good size and gives no reason to complain at all. The beds are comfortable and the room cleaners do a fine job. I would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location for first night after flight”
Reviews.Author: TheGaskins
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel for value and location as we wanted somewhere not too far from the airport after a 10 hour flight with some where to eat in walking distance. It took 20 minutes to get here from the airport and we payed to park in the underground carpark $12. We walked down the road 5 minutes and caught the aqua bus over to Granville Island where we looked around the market and ate in the food hall. The hotel is not in a great area of the city but was perfect for our needs. At no time did we feel unsafe. Breakfast was very good, buffet or cooked to order. Staff very pleasant and helpful. Good stop over hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and clean”
Reviews.Author: atlasttime2travel
Reviews.Content: We just wanted an overnight getaway to Vancouver that didn't cost too much; and we found it because at $129.00 plus 16.5% taxes the Quality Inn was great value. The room was pretty typical for a Quality Inn. It was clean and everything worked. The location was good with Robson Street and Granville Streets an easy walk and the ferry across to Granville Island was a ten minute walk down the hill. Parking was $12 under the hotel. The fare included breakfast which turned out to be in a nice looking restaurant off the lobby. We did not stop to eat but the staff was super about getting us two coffees to go. Next time we will stop for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic customer service”
Reviews.Author: AMJ1977
Reviews.Content: Had a very pleasant 6 night stay at this hotel in August of this year. It is a 3-star hotel but a very good one at that. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff on reception and they were there to help with any questions or advice needed whilst staying there. Got upgraded to the suites as it was our honeymoon so cannot comment on the standard rooms. The suites are nice and worth the upgrade cost. Very spacious and clean. Had the biggest bed i've ever slept in in my life! A kettle in the room as well as a coffee maker. Very powerful shower and the addition of bath robes being a very nice extra. Location is spot on, short walk to the aquabus where you can get across to Granville Islands which is well worth a trip. There is a Tim Hortons and a 7-11 nearby which proved very useful. Only a short walk to Robson Street for all the shops! The bar in the hotle is nice for a quiet beer after a hectic day. I would definitely recommend a trip to Whistler (on the rocky mountaineer train) and a gentle cyle right around the bay - costs about $20 for 5 hours. This hotel was a great choice and it was a pleasure to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet room, cheerful service, very clean hotel, great location...all round great”
Reviews.Author: quilchena
Reviews.Content: The good news: - Rosette efficiently took our reservation, then later gave good restaurant recommendations, even suggesting taking the boat taxi over to Granville Island ($5 return trip per person). - Front desk clerk Frank Grant's great smile was a welcoming bonus upon our arrival, and his friendliness extended when we crossed paths the next day on a nearby busy Vancouver street. - The restaurant staff were most attentive, and genuinely friendly. - We requested a room at the back as we were sleep deprived. Bonus was that the room was beautifully bright during the day and extremely quiet during the night. - Our room was very very clean, and very comfortable. The best news: Price was right. Place was great. Would highly recommend it for service, location and value. I felt very safe walking alone in the neighbourhood while my husband and sons were away doing their thing during the day. It is about 15 minutes to walk to Robson Street for dinner and shopping. Buses are just outside the door, and 7-11 are nearby for buying day passes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Moncana
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel and had a very pleasant experience. The hotel is centrally located, within walking distance to many restaurants and false creek, where you can catch the 'aquabus' to Granville Island. The rooms were clean and spacious. The hotel staff was very nice and helpful when we asked about directions and places to eat. There is a sushi place right around the corner (on Pacific St.) that is really good and has great prices. There is also a White Spot restaurant, also around the corner (on Drake St.), great place for breakfast and very kid friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: bill52647
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight before taking a Northbound Alaska cruise. Although this is an older hotel, it is well kept and in a great location. The staff, especially Stephen, went above board in helping us find things to do, places to eat, etc. The morning of our cruise, we were able to check out and the hotel staff stored our luggage until we returned from some more touring of town. They were then very helpful in getting us a taxi to the ship. Even though we only stayed one night, we felt that we were longtime guests by the way we were treated.

Reviews.Title: “'Safe Haven'”
Reviews.Author: Raymondclose
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable hotel where all the staff were efficient and helpful. The rooms/beds very comfortable. Breakfast was well presented and served. The bar staff very friendly. Ideally situated to get to Granvilles Island and walk to Stanley Park. Will certainly stay again should we be in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value & Good Time”
Reviews.Author: RedLadySanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Expedia and it lived up to our expectations. The friendly front desk, especially Leanne, was extremely helpful in providing information to us. They also assisted in booking our bus trips to Victoria and to Seattle. We had a good visit. Housekeeping was also friendly and accomodating - we needed more coffee and non allergetic pillows. Although we did not eat in the restaurant, we did visit the bar which was clean and service was friendly. Weather did not permit us to take advantage of the pool. This hotel is located in Downtown and close: within walking distance to restaurants which were very inexpensive and good tasting.

Reviews.Title: “TRULY EXCELLENT SERVICE”
Reviews.Content: I am in in the "customer service" industry, myself and am very respectful of the people who carry out the jobs of delivering EXCELLENT customer service in whatever job it is that they do. When I travel I am very low profile. I make my own bed. I re-use the towels! The FRONT DESK staff were exceptional. They loaned me their stapler without the least hesitation! ( that can be a VERY big deal!) . They came up with a very suitable vase for my parrot tulips I picked up from a street vendor. The ice bucket was not doing them justice. I think "catering" was involved too. Thanks. I experienced a taxi driver dropping off a "found article" left in his cab the day before by an unknown lady who he had dropped off at the hotel. The front desk knew all about the incident and thanked the driver on the lady's behalf. Very gracious. Concierge Service. The room was large and pleasant. Great bed. Everything was just fine. All the TV channels! VANCOUVER is a great city. No matter which way you walk you'll find water. Turn "right" for FALSE CREEK or turn "left" and keep walking until you get to Burrard Inslet. Great location. Honest. It's a great little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room in older building, great location”
Reviews.Author: teedotTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights after finding a great rate on Travel Zoo. The hotel is well situated and only a couple of blocks to some great breakfast places, trendy restaurants and bars in Yaletown and the ferry that we took to Granville Island. Though it's on the edge of the island, it is still within walking distance to Robson and the downtown core. The building is a little older and in need of some updating, particularly the hallways. The rooms are of a decent size and our king size bed was comfortable. The bathroom is a bit small, definitely only one person in at a time. The water pressure of the shower was great, but the bathroom fan didn't do anything but make noise and the true age of the hotel showed most in this room. Our room faced Howe St. so it was nice to see the city, but there is a steady stream of traffic going towards the Granville bridge and the windows don't do a whole lot to keep the noise out. I never heard any TVs or anyone talking, but I could hear doors opening and closing in the halls and even heard our neighbor's 6am wake-up call (which they missed multiple times). Good points about the hotel: the rooms are clean, there are ice machines and water dispensers in the hallway, the underground parking is cheap and convenient with in-and-out privileges, the front desk staff is helpful enough, local telephone calls are free, wireless internet was easy to access, good location and great price. Some cons about the hotel: rooms aren't soundproof, bathroom is small, decor is dated, heating/cooling system is quite loud and elevators are super slow (especially when busy). At the same price ($69/night), we'd definitely return to the Quality Hotel if ever in Vancouver again.

Reviews.Title: “bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: mom12312
Reviews.Content: Went there because I found a deal on Travelzoo and my daughter had a sporting event out there. Regular rates are over 130 per night. Room very small, but fine for a place to sleep when you get the room for alot less than regular rate!! When it got terrible was when I went to go to sleep and realized both beds were broken! My daughter was already asleep so I thought I could get comfy and sleep, but didn't sleep all night. I tried climbing in with her and that is when I realized her bed was broken too! I spoke to the manager about it in the morning, he came up and looked at it and told me there was nothing he was going to do for me because I should have asked to move rooms - even after my daughter was sleeping!!! He saw that they were broken and not good to sleep on. We went out there so she could get a good sleep - you think they would understand why I didn't want to move rooms in the middle of the night. Things happen - I understand that, but you would think they would offer at least to not charge us for parking or something - or a credit for another stay - but nothing was offered. It was too bad so sad. I was very dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but you can do better”
Reviews.Author: cya
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a get away weekend. After years of always staying on or near Robson we decided to try this area. Thought not far from Yaletown and Robson businesses, it was still far enough away to make it inconvenient. The area wasn't as nice and there was not a whole lot around except the Granville Bridge. The hotel itself was OK not bad but hardly exceptional. Except for the WSU Lacross team passing through, the bar was empty on a Saturday evening. Breakfast was boring but service and staff were good. I guess the major source of our disappointment was the name. The Inn at False Creek was just an average Best Western under a bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value, staff”
Reviews.Author: JustForFun23
Reviews.Content: I was highly, highly impressed by this hotel. Front desk staff was more attentive than at most luxury properties. They eagerly: called a cab for me several times, gave me sightseeing advice, coupon books, granted a last-minute late check-out, stored baggage, and exchanged currency with a smile on their face. Hotel restaurant/bar a decent value for hotel food. False Creek area is absolutely beautiful. The only caveat is to be careful if you're alone at night. You can hear a lot of street noise and you may run into a beggar or two. But I never felt that my safety was at risk. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Brats
Reviews.Content: Christmas shopping trip we stayed just one night it was really nice much better than expected even though all the reviews were great , So read the reviews and trust them our room was high on the road side ( pretty quiet ) with fantastic night views,walking distance to Robson for great restaurants . We really enjoyed our stay at the Quality Inn Downtown Free Internet parking is $12 a day but this is downtown its to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: grayce58
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, wonderful staff, make you feel at home when you are on the road as much as I am. Comfortable rooms and a nice friendly and welcoming lounge. Highly recommend if you are in Vancouver working.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and waterside location”
Reviews.Author: CreepingBeauty
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel. The service was excellent, the staff were very helpful and knowledgeable when I asked about local attractions. When I wanted to confirm our onward flights to Toronto, I asked where how to use the pay phone and the gentleman at reception made the call for me from the reception phone, therefore costing me nothing. We had a suite on the top floor with a beautiful view out over False Creek and the city looked amazing at night. It was very well equipped and a good size. with seperate kitchen, bedroom, balcony , bathroom and lounge The closed-in 'balcony' was lovely to sit in on the warm evenings with the windows open. The location was good too, right on the side of False Creek which was nice to walk to in the mornings after breakfast before setting off for the day. There was a little boat port right at the bottom of the road the hotel is on, so we hopped over to Granville Island every day to make the most of the huge market selling all sorts of fresh food, that we took back to our suite and enjoyed for dinner. Getting into the heart of the city is about 5mins walk up the road, where you will meet Robson Street, the main road of shopping and restaurants. Everything was within walking distance, the only time we used any form of transport was for the airport and to go to Grouse Mountain on the North Island which is much to far to walk, you have to go by boat and then a bus the other side. I can not wait to return to Vancouver, it's an amazing city and I would stay at False Creek again.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it”
Reviews.Author: zduk
Reviews.Content: really disappointed in this hotel.It was billed as a "boutique" hotel, however, on arrival there was no evidence of this. The hallways were dark and dirty, reminiscent of a scene from the Shining with the maroon colour. The rooms were outdated and shabby, with poor quality finishes and very dark. The only redeemable feature were the staff, although the front desk person was also the maintainance man.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Franklinross
Reviews.Content: A good basic 2.5 star hotel in Downtown Vancouver. Easily access buy YVR Airporter bus. www.yvrairporter.com . Rooms a little tired but very adequate and clean and well serviced. We stayed 7nights and got a free upgrade to one of the suites. Perfect for long stays as it has a full kitchen with stove, oven, microwave, fridge/freezer, pots and pans, cutlery and a bit more room. FREE wirless Internet is the big bonus for us as we run a business and worked quite a lot from the laptop in the room. Staff very helpful and pleasent. Eaisly get to main CBD in 10-15mins walking and Canada Place (Harbour) in 20-25mins. Central Vancouver is Flat (no hills).

Reviews.Title: “Totally better then I expected!”
Reviews.Author: Prime-image
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the quality in as part of a stagette weekend. 4 other girls and I had an awesome stay at this hotel! It had a great location - within walking distance to granville island, and Robson street. As a local to the area I know most of the hotels in Vancouver, and I do have my favorites, so when this hotel was chosen for me, I was not too happy. BUT, it turned out to be awesome!! They have 2 parking garages, which is a major plus for Vancouver. From our room, (#514) we could see false creek and had a great view. The beds were SO comfortable!! I usually hate the rock hard hotel beds that most cheap hotels have, but these beds were heaven! The feather fillows and comforters were awesome too! I also had a chance to have a sleep on a cot for a bit, also VERY comfortable. The room was big (big enough for 6 girls to get ready in) and the hotel itself was very clean. I didnt see a single problem with the hotel. And I loved the shampoo and conditioner provided by the hotel, as well as the lotion- something I usually steer clear of in hotels. The price was AWESOME for a downtown hotel. The area is great, close to GM place, and everything you could want. It was very quiet, I never once heard someone in the hallway or on the street. The staff were friendly and helpful. I definitely will be staying here next time I need a hotel and will totally be recommending this place to anyone I know from out of town.

Reviews.Title: “A Great "Home Base" in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: delphi11
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the hotel with our two young children. The room was large and clean, and the hotel overall was quite quiet. It was excellently located for our walking tours of downtown Vancouver. We especially loved Granville Island, which was only steps away. We would definitely return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: harbincity
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights and found this hotel to be fairly priced for Vancouver (expensive city). Comfortable, good breakfast and very helpful staff. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal”
Reviews.Author: mPDX
Reviews.Content: Our four night stay was great. Ideal location for walking to all the downtown sights, walking along the bay, taking the mini ferry to Granville Island, really enjoying this wonderful city. Nice room, very clean, friendly and efficient staff. Good, secure garage. We wished the bed was less hard, and the wireless was stronger, but those are minor. Best value for money downtown. We'll certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Whitec
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location a short walk to the aqua bus which takes you to Granville Island and the tourist trolley bus stops right outside the hotel. The staff are very friendly and helpful we had a mix up with the dates we had booked and the staff sorted the problem straight away with no extra charge. The rooms are big and clean. Parking is extra but there are plenty of spaces. We would return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: fiona229
Reviews.Content: Booked this directly with the hotel. The familyroom was a decent size with two double beds in the bedroom, a sofa bed and a kitchenette. Got a good deal for breakfast and had the full Canadian which was fine. The swmming pool was not particularly attractive but after a very hot day was fantastic. The hotel is very conveninet for down town and for the ferries to Granville island. I think it is very good value for money and would recommend it to any families travelling with teenagers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, good location, helpful staff, but a little bit noisy.”
Reviews.Author: FiftyNiner
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to be listed twice in Tripadvisor, as Quality Inn At False Creek and as Quality Hotel Downtown. As far as I can make it out they refer to the same hotel. I stayed there in the end of June 2008. I like this hotel. They've got nice, comfortable and clean rooms. The staff is friendly and helpful, and it is a nice and central location at the edge of Downtown Vancouver. However, the rooms facing Howe street gets quite a lot of traffic noise. ---- My first impression was it was very impersonal, as it tends to be in a chain hotel of this size. However, as soon as I got to the room the impression was; What a comfortable room! The room was absolutely spotlessly clean and very comfortable, with a nice comfortable armchair to cuddle up in, and a comfortable bed. As well as the armchair there is the standard hotel little writing table and chair. Plenty of huge drawers and a closet to put your clothes and stuff in. Nicely decorated, probably very recently, in some kind of modernized mexican colour scheme, with rich brownish colours. The decorator has somehow managed to do this without making the room look drab or dark. The bathroom was not quite as newly redecorated, but was spotlessly clean. Not very big, but adequate. --- The hotel is just beside the Howe street ramp to the Granville street bridge, meaning the rooms at the front of the hotel do get quite a lot of traffic noise. And the view is not exactly beautiful, but interesting. ---- OK, so one or two of the buildings immediately around the hotel are not exactly brand new and well kept, but the area seems quite nice and most of the surrounding buildings are quite new residential buildings. If you walk a few blocks down the street in front of the hotel, you are down by False creek, in a nice residential area with a very nice walk along the water, with boats, the tiny ferries across False creek, a view of Granville Island, some green patches and residential buildings, and lots of people taking their evening stroll. A few minutes along this walk and there is a beach continuing all the way to Stanley park. A few blocks walk the other way is Downtown. -- I found the front desk staff to be very friendly and helpful. The restaurant is friendly and serves good breakfast, many different options. But for sure you can get breakfast at a lower cost if you walk just a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Well located & great value”
Reviews.Author: DerbyshireJethro
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the last night in Canada, chosen specifically for its close proximity to the Yale blues venue. I love it when I get lucky! Although our rental car was too tall for the underground parkade, they were happy for me to use the staff car park. On getting to our room we found we had been upgraded to a suite, (we had prepaid the room months before so it turned out to be a free upgrade) The rooms were extremely well equipped, the bed was full king size & hugely comfortable. The staff were really friendly and helpful and the only thing to mar the experience at all was beyond the control of the hotel. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel, but if you're staying (anywhere) in Vancouver in the next year or so, be prepared for lots of construction noise from dawn to dusk, as the city readies itself for the 2010 Winter Olympics.

Reviews.Title: “Right Place at the Right Price”
Reviews.Author: westcoast_canada
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property for one night and received an online rate of $107.00. The hotel was very adequate for the price paid, the rooms were clean, comfortable, well decorated and staff were very friendly. The hotel is only seven storys high so you do not get too much of a view. The location of the hotel is on the outskirts of the downtown core, about a 10 to 15 minute walk to Robson St. shopping, 30 minutes to GM Place and probably a 45 minute walk to Stanley Park and the aquarium. I did not use the pool although it looked clean and well maintained although small. I do recommend this property to others who are looking for a more reasonable priced hotel downtown.

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: jazzyjaz79
Reviews.Content: small rooms no microwave or fridge pool is in a BACK ALLEY--where bums rummage through the bins. and they can just sit there and watch you swim. NOT a good place for kids to stay--walls are hollow. Front desk new nothing of where to go for a grocery store.. when i complained about thier photos on website being deceiving( ie-pool in alley) they were not phased. 230 a night-- for what?! so that my 6 foot tall husband can crouch over to get under the showerhead? Parking sucks and you have to PAY! View isn't very nice either... i could go on..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & a Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cricklewood
Reviews.Content: A three night stay at the end of our journey from Calgary across the Rockies other hotels visited were · Sandman Hotel Calgary · Mount Royal Banff · The Thompson Kamloops · Amethyst Jasper Journies end. Well-located hotel a few minutes walk from the city centre & the river with the ferries to Granville Island. Nice reception, with restaurant off, rooms on floors above. A swimming pool to the rear. Bedrooms were a good size & comfortable, bathrooms clean with change of laundry each day. Staff pleasant – in short the hotel does it 's job without fuss – a perfectly good location to either finish off your tour or to do business in As for food & supplies – there is a store across the street, a 7/11 round the corner, in the evening we dined at the Yaletown Brewery – a vast pub with a good micro brewery attached, and at the both the Boathouse ( good value & great views) & Rain City Grill ( a bit pricey) in English Bay a 20 minute walk down ‘Pacific’ from the Quality. For Breakfast if you have time take the $2.5O aqua-taxi ride to Granville Island you will not be disappointed. The Quality is a decent hotel in a good location that does what it says on the tin.

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sproutandthebean
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Quality Inn for a couple of nights before returning to the UK. It is well located at False Creek, to either visit Granville Island or walk to the shops or other attractions. Good bus routes nearby. Pretty similar standard to other Quality Inns we have stayed in. The front of house and waiting staff are all helpful, the restaurant food is good and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: dave6503
Reviews.Content: From arrival to departure the stay was wonderful. The staff is the best, very friendly and helpful. I cannot say enough good things about the staff or the hotel. The rooms are very clean and bright. The hotel is right in the middle of everything. Davie Village is a two minute walk. Granville Island is also a short distance. It seemed like a very safe neighborhood. The rooms are so affordable. You definately get more than what you pay for here. I will stay here each and every time I return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but know the downsides...”
Reviews.Author: Eclipse2008
Reviews.Content: Upside: 1) Relatively cheap with their 3 nights for 2 offer. 2) Quiet (at rear of hotel) 3) Oven/grill 4) Free Wi-Fi internet access from room Downside: 1) The hotel misrepresents itself - there is a prominent picture of a waterfront location/building in the front page of the hotel website at http://www.innatfalsecreek.com/ but it turned out that this is NOT the hotel (or the hotel's location), despite it being the only outside shot, and no other picture on their site to counteract this misleading impression. Instead it is an oldish building on a major road in what seemed a run-down district. 2) The name is Inn at False creek - this would support the waterside location implied from the photo above, but is also not the case. It is not AT False creek, although is relatively near. 3) The first impression of the hotel / room was so different from that implied/imagined from the photos on the hotel website we were minded to check out immediately. The room is (apparently partly refurbished) in a very old fashioned style, and gives a dowdy run-down hotel impression. The kitchen and bathroom fittings were old, scratched and dirty, adding to this impression. 4) Coming from Europe we did not know/expect that the fan unit on the wall was the only source of heat - we thought it was an air conditioner and left it alone(off), especially as the scale just said 1-10 with 10 as cooler. We were VERY cold in the night (I caught a chill/Cold which lasted our whole holiday). When we found out it heated and was the only source of heat, we used it only to find it far too noisy and dry for comfort. There was no temperature setting (Degrees or Fahrenheit) - just the scale from 1 to 10 to experiment with each night. It also never shuts off.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KittiekatBrooklyn_NY
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in great location, just across the water from Granville Island. There's also a 7/11 and a little grocery store only one block from the hotel. The rooms were very nice for the price. I paid a little over $300 for a double for 4 nights.

Reviews.Title: “A caring Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fishpieStockport
Reviews.Content: I arrived with my wife in late August 2007 on a Travelsphere holiday. My wife was taken seriously ill- the holiday abandoned and I remained at the Quality hotel for 29 days. The staff - room cleaner - barperson - manager - everyone were absolutely brilliant. THEY CARED. After 12 days I was moved into a suite - wife still critically ill - hotel could not have been better. Rooms clean, well serviced, efficient staff. Hotel food is excellent - tasty - brilliant sould, excellent fish and ships ! and chef's salads. front desk brilliant, esp. Al and Leanne, but unfair to name but 2. Some of the back roome suffer from eaarly morning 7am) noise, but that linked to a city workers strike (9/07). arooms - spotless ; linen similar; desk - amazing; lounge - great with its own 'Cheers' type group of locals. who care.l Would we come back ?- depends upon my wife's frame of mind. Would we stop here - absolutely. SO LONG AS YOU ARE NORMAL, UNSPOILED AND DONOT EXPECT SOMETHING MORE THAN YOU PAID FOR. - BRILLIANT VALUE FOR MONEY - FOR MY MONEY -UNACCOUNTABLE. Vyner mates (UK) - 9/07.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Excellent Position”
Reviews.Author: Bruluec
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel as part of a tour organised by Travelsphere. The rooms were tastefully decorated, the bathroom was on the small side but stilll adequate.The staff were very friendly and helpful and the hotel is in a very good position - just a short walk from the water to cross over to Granville Island. The restaurant in the hotel was excellent. A good all round Hotel ideal for touring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: alaska07_7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located about a 15 minute walk from Robson Street, so its a good location. The price was not bad for downtown vancouver either, though breakfast was not included and was a little pricey for what you got, I would suggest have breakfast downtown it would be cheaper and you would get more for your money. The rooms were nice, clean and comfy bed. Would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “good place for family and a dog”
Reviews.Author: radarsmom
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel for a reasonable price. Nothing fancy but the room was clean (abeit a bit small for a family of 4 and a dog) and nicely appointed. We were on the alley side which was quite quiet. The free internet was very very slow. The best part was that our dog was able to stay in his crate in the room while we attended a wedding (some hotels won't let you leave your dog in the room unattended no matter what!) We didn't have time to try out the pool but it looked fun although quite small. This is a great place to stay if you are not planning on spending a lot of time in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: gburg2000
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located, well-appointed, and an overall great place to stay. It is a few blocks from both the Granville Island ferry and Yaletown. The rooms are nicely decorated, large, and some overlook the water. Parking at $12/day is reasonable and secure(plus, you get in-and-out privileges). The double-decker tour bus stops just outside the front lobby. Plus, it is within easy driving distance to all Vancouver attractions (you'll just have to navigate the city streets). I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: mistress_clove
Reviews.Content: The Quality Hotel - Inn at False Creek is a clean and comfortable place right in the very heart of downtown Vancouver! It's not fancy in any respect (the main entrance is right on an access road that turns into the overpass of the Granville Street Bridge), but it's well-kept and quite adequate for a weekend getaway to BC. We stayed at the hotel over the Canada Day weekend -- got a pretty good price through one of the Vancouver tourism websites. As part of the online deal, I couldn't pick the size of bed, and we ended up in a room with two doubles. Although I would have preferred a queen bed, the mattresses were very comfortable, with foam tops and good support. The hotel staff was friendly and our room was very quiet. There's even an underground parking area right at the hotel (although I think there's a parking fee). The hotel is just blocks away from the Vancouver waterfront and many downtown neighborhoods. You can even walk right out the front door and across the bridge to Granville Island. If you're looking for fancy, this isn't it. But if you're looking for convenience and a comfy place to crash for a few nights, try the Quality Hotel - Inn at False Creek!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: PurdyIsleofWight
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights and thoroughly enjoyed it here. Hotel is very busy with tour parties but the front desk staff are very pleasant and helpful and the room was clean and quiet. We chose the location after reading reviews of other hotels a lot of which seem to be in quite seedy areas of the town so have no complaints about it being a bit quiet, certainly didn't hear any of the traffic on the nearby roadbridge to Granville Island. Stanley Park is a very pleasant 30 minute waterfront stroll away and Granville Island is absolutely delightful and reached by a tiny bathtub looking ferry minutes from the hotel. We loved Vancouver and will definately return.

HotelInfo.Name: Quality Hotel - Inn at False Creek
HotelInfo.Address: 1335 Howe Street, Vancouver, British Columbia V6Z 1R7, Canada
